title: Room 4: Treatment Control Room
description: You’ve reached the final room: the treatment control room. Purification systems of the town are collapsing and bad household practices are one of the main reason. You must transfer the knowledge about safe home-level strategies to restore clean water to the town.

questions.question: Which of the following can help reduce DBPs in drinking water?
questions.explanation: Filters can remove DBPs and other chemicals from tap water.
questions.learning_content: Use certified filters (like carbon-based) to reduce DBPs at home.
questions.Clue: It’s a common appliance used right at the tap.

questions.question: What is a simple way to reduce DBPs from hot water use?
options: Use only cold water for cooking
questions.explanation: Shorter showers reduce steam inhalation and overall DBP exposure from hot water.
questions.learning_content: Shorter hot showers = less DBP exposure.
questions.Clue: Less time with steam means less exposure.

questions.question: How does ventilation help during hot water use?
options: It removes DBPs from the air
questions.correct_answer: It removes DBPs from the air
questions.explanation: Good ventilation helps clear DBPs released in steam during activities like showering.
questions.learning_content: Open a window or use a fan to lower airborne DBP exposure.
questions.Clue: Air movement can clear out more than just heat.

questions.question: Which water source is typically lower in DBPs?
questions.explanation: Filtered water can significantly reduce DBP levels.
questions.learning_content: Filtered water usually contains fewer DBPs than untreated tap water.
questions.Clue: It’s been cleaned a step further than regular tap water.

questions.question: Why shouldn't you rely only on boiling water to remove DBPs?
questions.explanation: Boiling can concentrate certain DBPs instead of removing them.
questions.learning_content: Boiling water doesn’t always reduce DBPs—use proper filtration instead.
questions.Clue: Heat doesn’t always mean safer, it might intensify certain things.
